intro: Serianthes germainii, commonly known as the black mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black bark and its ability to thrive in saline environments. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers. The fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind and water.
